title: The Mark Hotel opens lavish penthouse suite
text:
16 shares 1
View
comments
Billionaire travellers and holidaying celebrities have a new hideaway in one of the most exclusive neighbourhoods in the world, with the long-awaited opening of the largest penthouse suite in the US.
Set in New York’s Upper East Side, The Mark Hotel's 12,000 square foot penthouse is the most expensive suite in the world – at $75,000 (£50,000) a night – and arguably the most extravagant.
The cavernous suite has five bedrooms, six bathrooms, a stately dining room that can seat 24 people, and a 2,500 square foot rooftop terrace with breathtaking views of the city’s skyline and Central Park.
Set in New York’s exclusive Upper East Side, the 12,000 square foot penthouse at The Mark Hotel is the largest in the US
The penthouse suite boasts a lavish living room that can be converted into a full-size grand ballroom with 26ft high ceilings
Occupying the hotel's top two floors (left), the suite has a 2,500 square foot private rooftop terrace with stunning views of New York
Billed as a ‘castle in the sky’, the palatial space is more like a grand residence than a hotel suite, covering the top two floors of a 1927 landmark building.
It represents the rise of the luxury ‘super suite’, and should have no shortage of famous guests, as The Mark Hotel is a preferred five-star retreat for power players and A-list celebrities.
Those who are fortunate enough to spend a night in the suite will enjoy lavish amenities and be pampered with around-the-clock care from staff and the hotel’s partners.

Share this article Share Designed by French interior designer Jacques Grange, the suite boasts a private lift and a living room that can be converted into a full-size grand ballroom with 26ft high ceilings and a grand piano.
The master bedroom features a free-standing floating gas fireplace and sitting room, adjoining his-and-hers dressing areas with custom-built walk-in closets, and his-and-hers master bathrooms with heated floors and towel racks, an infinity deep-soaking tub and Lefroy Brooks fixtures.
There are four fireplaces that guests can cosy up to on chilly nights, two powder rooms where they can touch up and two wet bars where they can prepare the tipple of their choice.
The Mark Hotel's cavernous penthouse has five bedrooms (left), six bathrooms (right) and a stately dining room that can seat 24 people
Other features within the suite include a grand piano, two wet bars, two powder rooms, a library lounge and conservatory
MOST EXPENSIVE HOTEL SUITES IN THE WORLD
The Mark Hotel , New York: $75,000 (£50,000)
Hotel President Wilson , Geneva: $60,000 (£40,000)
Four Seasons Hotel , New York: $55,000 (£35,000)
The Raj Palace , Jaipur, India: $45,000 (£30,000)
Laucala Island Resort , Fiji: $44,000 (£29,000)
Grand Hyatt Cannes Hotel Martinez , Cannes: $35,000 (£23,000)
Grand Resort Lagonissi , Athens: $35,000 (£23,000)
St Regis Hotel , New York: $35,000 (£23,000)
Hotel Plaza Athenee , Paris: $27,000 (£18,000)
London West Hollywood , Los Angeles: $25,000 (£16,500)
The suite also has a conservatory and library lounge, and every piece of furniture has been custom-designed exclusively for The Mark Hotel, which bills itself as New York’s ‘most boldly lavish hotel’.
Well-to-do guests likely won’t be doing any cooking themselves, but the full-sized kitchen is every chef’s dream. It was designed by Piero Lissoni for Boffi, and has a custom island and professional appliances by Gaggenau and Miele.
For dining, guests have access to 24-hour room service by The Mark Restaurant by Jean-Georges, and can request an al fresco dining experience on the terrace with an exclusive menu prepared by three-Michelin-starred chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten.
Thanks to the hotel’s partnership with luxury goods department store Bergdorf Goodman, guests have access to around-the-clock service, meaning they can get their suits tailored at midnight if they fancy it.
They also have access to in-suite hair styling by the in-house Frederic Fekkai Salon, a private car and driver of their choosing, and personal training by Dan Flores.
Billed as a ‘castle in the sky’, the palatial space, designed by Jacques Grange, is more like a grand residence than a hotel suite
Every piece of furniture has been custom-designed exclusively for The Mark, which bills itself as New York’s ‘most boldly lavish hotel’
Located near Central Park and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, The Mark Hotel is a favourite retreat for A-listers and power players
Izak Senbahar, owner of The Mark Hotel, said the penthouse is the culmination of a near-decade long collaboration with Mr Grange.
He told MailOnline Travel in a statement: ‘The Mark penthouse oozes pure sex appeal for your wedding night, is beyond palatial for entertaining – with a ballroom to boot – and private enough to transact your multinational M&A deal, all at the same time. We are in the business of creating memorable experiences.’
For Mr Grange, his work on the penthouse suite is his largest project to date.
He said in a statement: ‘This majestic penthouse is the ultimate residence away from home for those who truly appreciate rarified luxury, who seek a grand space that is equally equipped to lavishly entertain as it is to provide a homely private oasis with the extraordinary amenities and services The Mark Hotel offers. It is really like a castle in the sky.’
With old-world charm and avant-garde design, The Mark Hotel is set in an Art Deco building with 106 rooms and 50 suites, in addition to the penthouse.
The penthouse will no doubt be occupied by celebrity guests next spring, when the hotel is teeming with famous faces, fans and paparazzi ahead of the star-studded Met Gala.
Given its proximity to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the lavish hotel is a popular hangout for stars before and after the event, which draws a who’s who of A-listers and raises funds for the museum’s Costume Institute.
